skill.name: write-plan
skill.tagline: Create structured development plans with built-in verification and human oversight
skill.shortSummary: Generates comprehensive project plans with verification steps and human review gates
skill.fullSummary: The write-plan skill helps developers create detailed project plans before making changes to codebases. It ensures thorough documentation of files, hypotheses, and verification approaches while prioritizing human review when needed. The skill produces structured plans following specific templates that guide implementation and validation.

highlights.title: Mandatory Planning Structure
highlights.description: Enforces a consistent plan template with required sections for goals, tasks, and verification. This ensures all plans follow the same format, making them easier to review and execute consistently across different projects and teams.

highlights.title: Built-in Verification Framework
highlights.description: Automatically includes verification steps for every plan, distinguishing between automated and manual testing approaches. The skill helps identify what evidence is needed to confirm changes work correctly and documents testing frameworks and specific test cases.

highlights.title: Human Verification Gates
highlights.description: Identifies when human review is required based on specific criteria like subjective judgment, security concerns, or financial authorization. This ensures critical decisions receive proper oversight before implementation proceeds.

highlights.title: Hypothesis Recognition
highlights.description: Systematically identifies assumptions and hypotheses in the planning process that need validation. The skill helps developers recognize what needs to be tested or verified before concluding that a plan is complete and ready for execution.

highlights.title: Task Dependency Management
highlights.description: Organizes tasks with proper dependencies and prioritizes human verification tasks to the beginning of the plan. This ensures that critical review steps happen early in the process, preventing wasted effort on unvalidated approaches.

steps.name: Announce Skill Use
steps.description: The skill announces its activation before beginning the planning process.
steps.details: This creates transparency about which tool is being used and sets clear expectations for the planning approach that will follow. It helps users understand they're entering a structured planning mode.

steps.name: Gather Requirements
steps.description: Collects all necessary information about the planned changes and their context.
steps.details: The skill assumes zero context about the codebase and documents everything needed, including exact files to modify, testing approaches, and verification evidence. It identifies hypotheses that need validation during this phase.

steps.name: Apply Templates
steps.description: Uses predefined templates for different plan components like project structure and verification.
steps.details: The skill follows strict formatting rules for different sections of the plan, ensuring consistency across all documentation. It selects appropriate templates based on what aspects of the project are changing.

steps.name: Identify Human Gates
steps.description: Determines which parts of the plan require human verification based on specific criteria.
steps.details: The skill evaluates the plan against categories like subjective judgment, security sensitivity, and financial authorization. It prioritizes these verification tasks early in the plan to ensure proper oversight.

steps.name: Generate Final Plan
steps.description: Produces a complete plan document ready for execution and review.
steps.details: The final output includes all required sections with specific instructions for implementation and verification. The plan is structured to be executed by other skills and includes clear next steps for the development process.
